instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: [DEAD]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
forgive me ignorance but when this happens cpu is gone right?
thanks?

threads.title: [DEAD]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
CPU CORE rail could have very low value as normal; depends which kind of CPU is used.
i7-3xxx will show 001 as normal.

So you probably don't have any short there...

threads.title: [DEAD]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: What is you resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: [DEAD]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 37589"]What is you resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>?[/QUOTE]

.5 ohm - 0 on diode mode.

threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 37584"]CPU CORE rail could have very low value as normal; depends which kind of CPU is used.

ah. its like measuring <SIGNAL>PP_CPU</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP_GPU</SIGNAL> on iphones - too low so it beeps right?

threads.title: [DEAD]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: Yeah thatâ€™s a dead CPU RIP

threads.title: [DEAD]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> short to ground
[DEAD]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
"too low so it beeps right"
If beeps doesn't mean is short.
Multimeters usually beep until 060-070; that is no short at all...

0.5oms (200ohms scale) could be short and dead CPU.
But is better to compare the value with a board with the same CPU.
